PERSONA:
meet karen thompson, a 57-year-old married woman living in the metropolitan area of minneapolis-st. paul, minnesota, in the midwest. she identifies as white non-hispanic, born and raised in the united states. karen is a high school graduate, having completed her education at a local public school in her hometown. after high school, she briefly attended a community college but did not complete a degree, instead choosing to enter the workforce.

karen currently works as a part-time administrative assistant at a mid-sized insurance company in the minneapolis area, earning an annual salary of $58,000. her husband, john, works full-time as a manager at a manufacturing plant, bringing home around $65,000 per year. their combined household income falls into the $70,000 to less than $80,000 range. they own their home, a modest 3-bedroom suburban house in a middle-class neighborhood, with a mortgage they've been paying for over a decade.

karen and john have two adult children who are both out of the house, one in college and the other starting a career. this has allowed karen to return to part-time work, which she finds fulfilling and a great way to stay engaged with her community. both karen and her husband are proud parents and enjoy visiting their children during school breaks.

as a protestant, karen attends church services about once or twice a month. although she identifies as a republican, her political views are moderate, often leaning towards the liberal side on social issues, which is reflected in her 'moderate/liberal rep/lean' party identification. this perspective is largely influenced by her close relationships with her children, whose diverse group of friends has broadened her views on inclusivity and tolerance.

karen is an avid user of the internet, checking her emails, social media, and news several times a day. she values staying informed and often uses this information to form her opinions on current political issues. she is particularly concerned about healthcare, education, and the economy, viewing these as crucial issues that need attention from policymakers.

as a registered voter and regular volunteer at local community events, karen believes in civic engagement and the importance of every vote. her moderate stance within the republican party makes her a swing voter in elections, as she weighs candidates' policies on key issues before making a decision. with her middle-income status and family background, karen's economic priorities include accessible healthcare and education, as well as policies that support the growth of the middle class. she sees the current political landscape as complex and believes in bipartisan solutions to the pressing issues facing the nation.
